Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2012 05:30PM GR4C1E wrote: I chose BMX with reconstruction and I have no regrets. Yes, there is numbness, but it has become my new normal. I don't really notice it most of the time. I have some recurring aches and pains from chemo that (so they tell me) will lessen over time, but I have no residual pain from the BMX. I do, however, have two lovely new foobs that look fantastic in a little black cocktail dress.
Posts.Title: UMX or BMX? kem510 kem510

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2012 09:55PM GR4C1E wrote: I have a question for the wig wearers out there. How easy or hard was it to make the transition and say "enough!" I don't care what people think! I feel like I'm wearing this thing to make other people comfortable around me. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice wig, but it's cut in a chin length bob, medium brown with lovely muted redish and gold streaks. My new and much appreciated hair growth is 11 weeks PFC and looks a lot like the awesome photo posted by tisthyme. It's also very gray with silver sparkles! So the difference is dramatic. I don't wear the wig at all around home or around town, but I do wear it for work. I'm actually dreading the day I go topless in a professional setting. I actually think I look cute, but I think my anxiety stems from a coworker who saw my hair while I was making some adjustments in the ladies room. She made a comment that I should be ready to ditch the wig in another couple of MONTHS. Months? I was thinking weeks. It really shook me up when she said that. Especially since she's also a BC survivor.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2012 10:11AM GR4C1E wrote: Just wanted to write a quick update and thank everyone for the kind words and encouragement.  I'm writing from my desk at work and, yes, I'm officially topless!  It's actually pretty awesome and everyone at work has been wonderful.  A few have even asked to touch my hair.  I've obliged, under one condition.  If they rub my head and later find out they've won the $540 million in the lottery tonight they have to split it with me!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2012 08:30PM GR4C1E wrote: Ksmatthews, liberating doesn't even begin to describe how I feel today! A coworker said, "If you put that damn wig on again today, I'll whip it off and beat you with it! You look fantastic!" LOL I was so nervous walking into our morning meeting, but everyone complimented me on my new do. Nobody had an unkind word. I underestimated them and I'm so happy for being so wrong.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2012 10:25PM GR4C1E wrote: Ossa, love your hair do. I'm rocking the same style as we speak. I think it's actually fascinating that strangers are very kind and accepting of my appearance and people I know can be insensitive. You're absolutely right, it is up to me. I have an appt with my oncologist next week. Before the ladies room incident, I was planning on asking him when I could possibly use a non-amonia rinse and beef up the color a bit. I like the silver bits and I think a darker salt and pepper look would make me feel a little more confident. I'm giving it two weeks tops, and I'm ditching the wig. Besides, having hair is not a job requirement and I have more hair than most of the men I work with!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 5, 2012 07:30PM GR4C1E wrote: Hilarious hair opportunity! I have to share. There's a guy at work that is so sexist. Can't stand him. So, I had been going topless for about three weeks, when finally, we crossed paths. He asked for my assistance on a project and I agreed to meet him to discuss. As we were walking towards eachother he asked me to stop. I obliged. He said; "What's going on here? You cut your hair! Turn around for me. I'm deciding whether I like it or not." So, I stopped and twirled. After my spin, I said; "I didn't cut my hair. It fell out after my first round of chemo. How do you like it now?"
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2012 11:24PM GR4C1E wrote: Elaine2Tervs, topless in public is surprisingly a piece if cake! I've actually surprised myself and been completely comfortable with it. It was easy for me once I realized that strangers don't have a "before" picture of me in their heads. I've never been one for big dangly earrings, but they really do look good with super short hair!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2012 02:26AM GR4C1E wrote: Before chemo I ordered some t-shirts for the occasion.  My favorite is red with the word "Baldilocks" in bold white letters, but the two fan favorites of the chemo lounge were "Does this shirt make my head look bald?"  and "I'm having a no hair day." I'm now 4 weeks PFC and starting to grow hair on my head while my eyebrows are just now thinning and falling out.  I found that out one day while pondering something deeply and scratching my forehead.  I accidently scratched off half of my right eybrow.  I had no idea until I went into my bathroom, flipped on the light and caught a glimpse of myself in the mirror.  I laughed so hard I almost peed myself!  Seeing someone get their eyebrow shaved off in a movie - very funny.  Seeing yourself with an eyebrow and a half - HILARIOUS!  Eyebrow pencils and wigs with bangs - priceless!
Posts.Title: So, you won the chemo lottery? TRY to find the humor! PlantLover fredntan
